alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 30 at 11:00AM MST until July 30 at 2:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Yavapai County in west central Arizona... * Until 200 PM MST. * At 1059 AM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Prescott, Downtown Prescott, Indian Hill West Prescott and Oak Knoll Village. This includes the following highways... State Route 69 between mile markers 294 and 296. State Route 89 between mile markers 310 and 320. State Route 89A between mile markers 318 and 321. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Granite Creek, Miller Creek, Willow Creek, Butte Creek, Bannon Creek, Bottleneck Wash and Agua Fria River. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
